summary: The term "sawmill" refers to facilities within the wood industry where logs are processed into lumber and other wood products. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, sawmills are subject to various directives and regulations aimed at ensuring sustainable forestry practices, environmental protection, and compliance with safety standards. The EU promotes responsible sourcing of timber through legislation such as the EU Timber Regulation, which seeks to prevent illegal logging and enhance traceability in the wood supply chain. Sawmills play a crucial role in the circular economy, contributing to resource efficiency and waste reduction in the wood industry.
